title: 'I have some gas left in the tank': At 37, Djokovic still has big tennis goals
description: Djokovic has had a rough start to 2025, but shown flashes of brilliance too. And he's aiming for that 100th tour win.
author: Simon Cambers

title: Pegula, Collins withdraw from U.S. BJK Cup team
description: The USTA said Wednesday that Jessica Pegula, Danielle Collins and McCartney Kessler had withdrawn from the United States' Billie Jean King Cup team, which faces Denmark on Saturday.

title: Unlock the Perfect Slice Serve - Essential Tennis Podcast #415
description: The wide slice serve is a CRITICAL tool to have in your tool box. It pulls opponents out of position, opens the court up for you to hit into, exposes their usually weaker backhand side, and forces them to run twice as far for the next shot - if they even get it at all. Let’s take a deep dive into how YOU can develop this powerful weapon, step by step in this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: 3 Djokovic Secrets To Winning More Matches - Essential Tennis Podcast #414
description: In this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast, you're going to learn the top 3 tactical secrets of Novak Djokovic that you can apply in your very next match. Use these tools to gain precision, consistency, and offense to make your opponents more uncomfortable, win more points, and win more matches.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: What were the Monte-Carlo Masters results?
description: Play continued on Wednesday at the Rolex Monte-Carlo Masters, the first clay-court ATP Masters 1000 event of the 2025 season. Carlos Alcaraz headlined the winners, while Alejandro Tabilo stunned Novak Djokovic. View all of the Monte-Carlo tennis results below. Results - Wednesday, 9 April 2025 Men's Singles - Round of 32 [Q] Daniel Altmaier (GER) d [WC] Richard Gasquet (FRA) 75 57 62 [2] Carlos Alcaraz (ESP) d Francisco Cerundolo (ARG) 36 60 61 Alejandro Tabilo (CHI) d [3] Novak Djokovic (SRB) 63 64 [9] Daniil Medvedev d Alexandre Muller (FRA) 76(6) 57 62 [13] Lorenzo Musetti (ITA) d Jiri Lehecka (CZE) 16 75 62 [7] Andrey Rublev d Gael Monfils (FRA) 64 76(2) [4] Casper Ruud (NOR) d Roberto Bautista Agut (ESP) 62 61 [15] Grigor Dimitrov (BUL) d [WC] Valentin Vacherot (MON) 46 63 61 Alejandro Davidovich Fokina (ESP) d Tomas Martin Etcheverry (ARG) 76(2) 63 [12] Arthur Fils (FRA) d Flavio Cobolli (ITA) 62 64 [8] Alex de Minaur (AUS) d Tomas Machac (CZE) 36 60 63 Nuno Borges (POR) d Pedro Martinez (ESP) 75 67(4) 64 Alexei Popyrin (AUS) d [14] Frances Tiafoe (USA) 36 63 63 Men's Doubles - Round of 28 [WC] Romain Arneodo (MON)/Manuel Guinard (FRA) d [5] Marcel Granollers (ESP)/Horacio Zeballos (ARG) 63 46 10-8 Men's Doubles - Round of 16 Rohan Bopanna (IND)/Ben Shelton (USA) d [3] Simone Bolelli (ITA)/Andrea Vavassori (ITA) 26 76(4) 10-7 [7] Julian Cash (GBR)/Lloyd Glasspool (GBR) d [WC] Petros Tsitsipas (GRE)/Stefanos Tsitsipas (GRE) 61 76(5) [1] Marcelo Arevalo (ESA)/Mate Pavic (CRO) d Sadio Doumbia (FRA)/Fabien Reboul (FRA) 63 36 10-7 [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: What is the Monte-Carlo Masters schedule?
description: Quarter-final spots are up for grabs Thursday at the Rolex Monte-Carlo Masters, where second seed Carlos Alcaraz headlines play on Court Rainier III. Indian Wells champion Jack Draper and three-time Monte-Carlo titlist Stefanos Tsitsipas will also be in action. On Court Des Princes, Daniil Medvedev, Casper Ruud, 2023 champion Andrey Rublev and Grigor Dimitrov are among the stars competing. Alejandro Tabilo looks to build upon his upset over 99-time tour-level titlist Novak Djokovic. View the full schedule for Thursday's play below. ORDER OF PLAY - THURSDAY, 10 APRIL 2025 Court Rainier III - start 11:00 AM [5] Jack Draper (GBR) vs Alejandro Davidovich Fokina (ESP) [Q] Daniel Altmaier (GER) vs [2] Carlos Alcaraz (ESP) Matteo Berrettini (ITA) vs [13] Lorenzo Musetti (ITA) Nuno Borges (POR) vs [6] Stefanos Tsitsipas (GRE) Court Des Princes - start 11:00 AM [7] Andrey Rublev vs [12] Arthur Fils (FRA) Not Before 1:00 PM Alexei Popyrin (AUS) vs [4] Casper Ruud (NOR) Not Before 2:30 PM [9] Daniil Medvedev vs [8] Alex de Minaur (AUS) Alejandro Tabilo (CHI) vs [15] Grigor Dimitrov (BUL) Court EA de Massy - start 11:00 AM Joe Salisbury (GBR) / Neal Skupski (GBR) vs [2] Harri Heliovaara (FIN) / Henry Patten (GBR) [4] Kevin Krawietz (GER) / Tim Puetz (GER) vs Hugo Nys (MON) / Edouard Roger-Vasselin (FRA) Followed By After Suitable Rest - [WC] Romain Arneodo (MON) / Manuel Guinard (FRA) vs Jack Draper (GBR) / Tomas Machac (CZE) Click Here to read: Three surprising facts about Djokovic's defeat in Monte-Carlo [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: Djokovic's wait for 100th title goes on after 'horrible' Monte Carlo loss
description: Novak Djokovic's wait for a 100th singles title continues after he exits the Monte Carlo Masters in a straight-set loss to Alejandro Tabilo.

title: Billie Jean King receives Hollywood Walk of Fame star
description: Legendary tennis player and social equality advocate Billie Jean King receives a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame.

title: Monte-Carlo Masters 2025 Day 4 Recap
description: Day 4 at the Monte-Carlo Country Club brought another upset at the Rolex Monte-Carlo Masters, as Alejandro Tabilo capitalised on Novak Djokovic’s ongoing struggles to secure a 6-3, 6-4 second-round win, while Carlos Alcaraz notched his first-ever victory at the event, storming back to defeat Francisco Cerundolo 3-6, 6-0, 6-1. The Round of 32 also …
author: Jonathan

title: Monte-Carlo Masters 2025 Day 3 Recap
description: Day 3 at the Monte-Carlo Country Club brought a whirlwind of action as the Rolex Monte-Carlo Masters Round of 64 concluded and the Round of 32 began, delivering upsets, 48-shot rallies and gritty comebacks on the red clay. Matteo Berrettini stole the headlines, ousting top seed Alexander Zverev in a 2-6, 6-3, 7-5 epic, while …
author: Jonathan
